page.title: 14NW.SHERBORNE:SCHOOLS (2)
page.content: This school is one of the two primary schools serving Sherborne. It is in the north of the town among the council houses and is known locally as {Simons Road School.}The main part of the school which the junior age children use was built in 1910: the infants block across the path was added in 1964. There are{240 children on roll aged 5 to 11, most live within {walking distance}of the school. There are three infant and five junior classes. The school has its own swimming pool and until 1980, when Dorset L.E.A. stopped providing school meals for Primary children, had its own school kitchen. School uniform is optional, it consists of white shirts with a green tie, green jumpers and grey skirts or trousers. The school's {badge}is a design based on the{cupola} at the top of the school roof.
